subject: RE: [junit] Re: Will JUnit 'fail()' trip up ALL code coverage tools?

Just curious...do you also write tests to test the code that tests the
tests?  If so, when do you stop?
 

--
Jim McMaster
mailto:jim.mcmaster@...



 


  _____  

From: junit@yahoogroups.com [mailto:junit@yahoogroups.com] On Behalf Of
pmcb552000
Sent: Tuesday, September 27, 2005 3:07 AM
To: junit@yahoogroups.com
Subject: [junit] Re: Will JUnit 'fail()' trip up ALL code coverage tools?


Hi guys,

Thanks for the replies, but both of you seem to think testing test
code is not worth it - I strongly disargee!  Rather than try to
justify myself, I'll simply defer to 'authority' and point you at an
article by the esteemed Elliotte Rusty Harold (in particular the
section 'Leave (almost) no code untested'):

http://www-128.ibm.com/developerworks/java/library/j-cobertura/

I'm still very surprised that I haven't been able to find any
references to what seems to me to be a very general code coverage
problem...

Pat.
